snippet: At Troy University in Alabama, a new residence hall caters to students who want an experience infused with religion, but some scholars see a conflict with the Constitution.
abstract: Troy University in Alabama opens new residence hall that caters to students who want a residential experience infused with religion; Christian dormitory is among new wave of religious-themed housing that constitutional scholars and others say is pushing boundaries of how much a public university can back religion.
lead_paragraph: At Troy University in Alabama, a new residence hall caters to students who want an experience infused with religion, but some scholars see a conflict with the Constitution.

headline.main: The Religious Dorm at the Public University
headline.print_headline: The Christian Dorm at the Public University
